data.title: Good view of town
data.text: We walked to the Sunsphere Tower from where the free electric trolley bus dropped us off on the Gay Street Route.  There was a field trip of children in the observation area, but we could read the displays to see what we were looking at in the town of Knoxville.  It was interesting.  I was a little bit disappointed in this sphere as a leading feature of the World's Fair in 1982.  I thought it would be grander.

data.title: Very cool
data.text: Awesome views from the top. Very interesting to read all about the world's fair at the top also. Very neat and well maintained park.

data.title: Great View of Knoxville
data.text: A lovely 360 view of the city and it's free. If you're in the area, you should definitely check it out.

data.title: Great Views and Free
data.text: For a great view of Knoxville and the surrounding areas, just take the free elevator and spend a few minutes walking around the observation level.

data.title: great free thing to do with amazing views
data.text:
I was told when visiting friends in Knoxville that I needed to check out the Sunsphere are it was part of the World's Fair from 1982 and cool views of the city and it was free.
I was fortunate enough to be able to go on a weekday when it wasn't crowded at all. 
The tower is right off the street, between the art museum and the World's Fair Park, and a short walk to Market Square. You walk to the elevator and head up to the observation deck level.
It was super simple to get up there, no line when I went. Hours are April through October: 9:00 a.m. - 10:00 p.m. and November through March: 11:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.
The views were pretty impressive. There were great views of the World's Fair Park from the level 4 observation deck.
The 5th floor has a restaurant that is supposed to be very good (but was closed on Monday when I visited).
It didn't take long to look out over the city and walk around the (enclosed) deck but I'm definitely glad I walked to the Sunsphere and checked it out and recommend others do too.

data.title: Fun and free!
data.text: Took our out of town friends up in "the big gold ball" and it was a hoot! A great way to see the surrounding area of Knoxville and it's free! What more can you ask for? We LOVE Knoxville!

data.title: Good for the kids to enjoy!
data.text:
The Sunsphere's view is lovely.  There's good information in the panels.
      Primo is the restaurant in the tower.  It has great views, especially in the bar section.  However, the food at the restaurant is average and the night that we went, the place was loud and we didn't get the table that we were promised.
     However, the Sunsphere area is clean and romantic for a good walk through.

data.title: Nice view, nice area to walk around
data.text: Visited after we went to the Chocolate Factory.  A nice view of the city, and the amphitheater and reflecting pond was clean and a nice walk.

data.title: Nice view
data.text: Went with family to visit Worlds Fair Park and the Sunsphere. My 4 year old grandsons wanted to go up in the gold marble. It wasn't at all crowded and we enjoyed seeing the area from above. There is no charge to go to the viewing deck. There is also an Italian restaurant in the sphere as well, but I have never eaten there

data.title: A panoramic view!
data.text: Our family enjoyed this tower.  It was easy to access and had a great view of the city.  We loved the informative panels with the history of the fair and of the city.

data.title: Wedding venue
data.text: Attended a wedding at the Sunsphere Tower and it was a perfect location for a small wedding.  Only negative is that moving people on the elevators takes some time and  planning, but a beautiful backdrop for a happy event.

data.title: Nice view along with history.
data.text: Great way to show visitors the town and surrounding vista.  Restaurant also great to relax and watch the sunset if it isn't too bright!

data.title: good view of knoxville
data.text: This gives you a great view of knoxville and is something nice to do if you are visiting World's Fair Park. However, it isn't very exciting...just a nice view...and it is free.

data.title: Sunsphere Tower
data.text: I found the views and photographs of those views from the park below to be better than the views from the tower itself. It's a simple, free elevator ride to the Tower.which was "okay." Th tower gives you a nice 360-degree view of the area. But the tower's windows were not clear and there wasn't especially anything brilliant within view. It is great, though, that there has been this revitalization from its earlier decline and disuse, and is certainly family-friendly.

data.title: A must see in Knoxville
data.text: Beautiful 360 degree view of Knoxville. You can see right into the University of Tennessee and a good portion of downtown Knoxville.

data.title: Must see
data.text: We did a 4 mile walking tour from Market Square to Volunteer Landing to Greenway to World Fair Park to Sunsphere.  Great way to see the city in half a day.  The view from the platform gives a unique perspective and is worth the effort.  It is a hilly walk and works if it is not hot and humid or raining.  Really enjoyed it. All free.

data.title: Ok
data.text:
The way to the top is from a lift at the park level.
The view around has signs which in my mind could have been better.
No that welcoming especially not the entrance

data.title: A must in Knoxville
data.text: If it is there then climb it.  The Sunsphere is an "I have been there'  attraction in the heart of Knoxville - for many people it will be the first glimpse they get of downtown.  It is worthwhile doing if only for the view.

data.title: needs some attention
data.text: The views from the sunsphere are great, and you can't beat the price.  (free) Getting up to the observation level is a challenge at times because the elevators are slow.  They make noises that can be scary.  I don't think they all are operational right now.  (I did recently hear that mgmt is looking into correcting this.  We were considering renting one of the floors for a party a few months ago, but changed our minds after looking at the space.  The window were very dirty, the walls were in bad shape, and there were multiple missing outlet covers.  It really wouldn't take that much to spruce it up.  I really hope that it receives some TLC soon because it's such a unique structure, and an ionic staple of the Knoxville skyline.

data.title: Free attraction offers an excellent 360 degree view .
data.text: This free attraction offers an excellent 360 degree view of the surrounding area from the viewing deck (I believe this is level 3 on the elevator).  The glass has window tint and could be cleaner, but the view is still good.  The inside is climate controlled and access is by elevator.  There is currently an Italian restaurant on one of the upper levels, although I did not go there.  There are instructions on finding the public parking online, but I just walked - it's very accessible from the riverfront, the University of Tennessee, or downtown.  Once there, you will probably spend no more than 15 minutes looking around.
